citation.article-title: Legionella birminghamensis sp. nov. isolated from a cardiac transplant recipient.

p.s: Description of Legionella birminghamensis sp. nov.
Legionella birminghamensis (bir. ming. ham. en' sis. N. L. fem. adj. birminghamensis coming from Birmingham, Alabama)
Legionella birminghamensis is a gram-negative, catalase-positive, motile rod that does not hydrolyze hippurate or produce a brown pigment on media containing tyrosine.
Its biochemical reactions are typical of the genus Legionella as described above.
It is serologically different from other described Legionella species.
Its cellular fatty acids are predominately branch chained.
The type strain of L. birminghamensis is 1407-ALH (ATCC 43702) which has a G+C content of 42.9 mol%.
It was isolated from human lung tissue.
